name: Trade Limits
pages: The "Trade Limit" & "Player Trade Limit" rules allow you to limit the number of interactions your customers can have with a given trade or trader.

pages.text: Both of these rules have two primary inputs. The first being the "limit" count, which is how many interactions are allowed before this rule locks the trade.$(br)The second is a button that allows you to forget about prior interactions and effectively reset the rule.

pages: Now that is where the similarities end. The normal "Trade Limit" rule applies to all players equally, and only allows the given number of trade/trader interactions period. Once that limit has been reached the trade/trader can no longer be interacted with at all by any player.$(br2) Now the "Player Trade Limit" rule is a bit more flexible and only limits each customer from interacting with the trade more than the given amount of times.

pages.text: It also has an additional timer input that allows you to forget about previous interactions from a player after a given amount of time has passed. This can be used to limit interactions so that other customers have an opportunity to buy an item that has a limited supply.
